> OK.  I currently have cloned one remote repository to my local computer.  I'm trying to clone a second repository.  I want to have both repository's open in the same VS Code workspace. \
  \
  Can you help me

ΓùÅ I'll help you clone a second repository and set up both repositories in the same VS Code workspace.

ΓùÅ Update Todos
  ΓÄ┐ ┬áΓÿÉ Help user clone second repository              
     ΓÿÉ Set up VS Code workspace with both repositories

ΓùÅ Update Todos
  ΓÄ┐ ┬áΓÿÉ Help user clone second repository              
     ΓÿÉ Set up VS Code workspace with both repositories

ΓùÅ First, let me check your current directory structure:

ΓùÅ List(~\Git)
  ΓÄ┐ ┬áListed 156 paths (ctrl+r to expand)

ΓùÅ I can see you have your Intranet repository and there's also a Coryphaeus directory. I notice there's already a VS Code workspace file: Multi-app SSO.code-workspace.

  To clone a second repository and set up both in the same workspace:

  1. Clone the second repository (provide me the repository URL and I'll help you clone it)
  2. Update the existing workspace file or create a new one with both repositories

  What's the URL of the second repository you want to clone?

ΓùÅ Update Todos
  ΓÄ┐ ┬áΓÿÆ Help user clone second repository              
     ΓÿÉ Set up VS Code workspace with both repositories

> The URL of the second repository is:  https://github.com/Mharbulous/Bookkeeper.git\
  \
  I want to clone it here:  C:\Users\Brahm\Git\Bookkeeper
  \
  \
  The first repository was:  https://github.com/Mharbulous/Intranet.git\
  And I have already cloned it here:  "C:\Users\Brahm\Git\Intranet"

ΓùÅ I'll help you clone the Bookkeeper repository and set up both repositories in a VS Code workspace.

ΓùÅ Update Todos
  ΓÄ┐ ┬áΓÿÉ Clone Bookkeeper repository to C:\Users\Brahm\Git\Bookkeeper
     ΓÿÉ Set up VS Code workspace with both repositories

ΓùÅ Bash(cd "C:\Users\Brahm\Git" && git clone https://github.com/Mharbulous/Bookkeeper.git Bookkeeper)
  ΓÄ┐ ┬áCloning into 'Bookkeeper'...

ΓùÅ Update Todos
  ΓÄ┐ ┬áΓÿÆ Clone Bookkeeper repository to C:\Users\Brahm\Git\Bookkeeper
     ΓÿÉ Set up VS Code workspace with both repositories

ΓùÅ Great! Now let me create a VS Code workspace file that includes both repositories:

ΓùÅ Write(~\Git\Multi-Repository.code-workspace)

     {
       "folders": [
         {
           "name": "Intranet",
           "path": "./Intranet"
         },
         {
           "name": "Bookkeeper",
           "path": "./Bookkeeper"
         }

ΓùÅ Update Todos
  ΓÄ┐ ┬áΓÿÆ Clone Bookkeeper repository to C:\Users\Brahm\Git\Bookkeeper
     ΓÿÆ Set up VS Code workspace with both repositories

ΓùÅ Perfect! I've successfully:

  1. Γ£à Cloned the Bookkeeper repository to C:\Users\Brahm\Git\Bookkeeper
  2. Γ£à Created a VS Code workspace file at C:\Users\Brahm\Git\Multi-Repository.code-workspace

  To open both repositories in VS Code:
  - Double-click on Multi-Repository.code-workspace or
  - Run: code "C:\Users\Brahm\Git\Multi-Repository.code-workspace"

  The workspace includes both your Intranet and Bookkeeper repositories as separate folders, with recommended extensions for Vue/JavaScript development.

> Terrific!\

  /export

ΓùÅ Great! Both repositories are now set up in your VS Code workspace. You can open the workspace file to work with both projects simultaneously.
Great! Both repositories are now set up in your VS Code workspace. You can open the workspace file to work with both projects simultaneously.

\
Can you modify my current workspace so that when I open a new terminal window it just defaults to: C:\Users\Brahm\Git
I'll modify your workspace to set the default terminal location to `C:\Users\Brahm\Git`.

content.text:
Perfect! I've added the `terminal.integrated.cwd` setting to your workspace configuration. Now when you open new terminals in VS Code, they'll default to `C:\Users\Brahm\Git` instead of prompting you to choose between the Intranet and Bookkeeper folders.

You'll need to reload the workspace for the changes to take effect.

Yes! I can see both repositories:

1. **Intranet** - Your first repository (Vue.js application)
2. **Bookkeeper** - Your second repository (also appears to be a Vue.js application)

I also notice there's a **Coryphaeus** directory - is this a third repository you're working with?

All three appear to be Vue.js applications with similar structures (Vue, Vite, Tailwind, Firebase, etc.).

\

content.text: The issue is that the `node_modules` dependencies aren't installed in the Bookkeeper repository. You need to run `npm install` first to install all the dependencies, including Vite.

content.text: [Request interrupted by user for tool use]

message.content: I need to run npm install in each directory separately?

content.text:
Yes, exactly! Each repository needs its own `npm install` because each has its own `package.json` and needs its own `node_modules` folder.

For both repositories to run in parallel, you'll need to:

1. **Bookkeeper**: `cd Bookkeeper && npm install && npm run dev`
2. **Intranet**: `cd Intranet && npm install && npm run dev` 

Each will run on different ports (usually 5173, 5174, etc.) so they won't conflict.
